reviews:
I don't remember how many times I've been to this beach, but every single time I'm mesmerized by its beauty, the amazing blue of the water, and the surrounding mountains that just accentuate the picture. For the past 2 years we've come around the same time in February and it was a great time to visit. We were lucky with a good weather and we enjoyed the beach tremendously. I would definitely recommend at least visiting it twive.

Loved the Sandy beach at Carmel.. beautiful setting and easily accessible.. very pretty area. A must see on the Pacific coast highway drive
Always beautiful. The weather was wonderful. Responsible dog owners. We got to see a pod of dolphins and seals at play. Nice long walk on the beach. Wonderful
We are a bit spoiled in Australia for beaches and so it's hard to find one that is exceptional. This wasn't but it was still very nice with a reasonable amount of sand and nice, clean water.

Beautiful beach. Easy access. Street parking only. Long, wide and sandy. Otters and seals easy to spot. Great view of Pebble Beach. Lots of people with dogs. I’ve never seen a better day than the day we spent there. 77 degrees and sunny! Just lovely. Check weather conditions before you go if from out of the area. It’s often overcast/foggy on this part of the CA coast.

I love this place. One of the cleanest beaches I have ever been. The sand is so so white. I recommend to go there, even in winter, just to appreciate it!

Amazing spot to watch the sunset - we saw dolphins playing in the water too, which was utterly magical. The beach is lovely to walk on barefoot, which is something I rarely do, but enjoyed here. Lovely to watch the dogs having a great time and you can see all the way to Pebble Beach too. Very laidback vibe here - feels very safe and is a quick walk from the heart of downtown.

Well mostly. I hope the people who do not pick up after their pets do not spoil it for most. Almost stepped in doggypoopy.
That would not have been a happy experience. It’s such a beautiful beach to walk. We enjoyed the sunset as we walked south then climbed the stairs and walked back to our car up by the street. I love this place.

If watching the sun sink into the ocean while dogs frolic on the beach is your thing, then you should probably come here for sunset. Parking is limited, come early.

There is no better beach in the entire world to job on that this one. The sand is so soft, the temperature is perfect and the dogs offer a welcome distraction to running ;) you can also jog up and down the many staircases for an extra cardio hit!

Carmel is place with serene & picturesque views.Absolutely loved it. Beautiful beaches, lovely sunset,good vibes with great local food outlets. Will recommend staying in Carmel.
Great beach / lagoon for bird watching & dog walking & sunset viewing!

We have three older dogs so we aren't interested in going to the Carmel City Beach, where younger ones are frolicking around off leash. We head to the quieter more out of the way Carmel River Beach. A small parking lot provides easy and level access to the beach and to a lagoon area, great for kids, bird watching, and strolling with your canine friends. We went there several times during a weekend trip to Carmel.

Best dog friendly beach. Relative low waves, lots of open sand for people and puppies. Bathroom and water fountain there. Bring your dog a water bowl to fill at the fountain after play. This was the first time our 6 month old lab was at the beach and he did drink a lot of water on the first day and had an upset stomach. Gave him some white rice and he was ready to go the next two days. He loved it.

I definitely recommend to walk the loop. There are some beautiful homes of all shapes and sizes and the beach is so beautiful and peaceful.
Always a gem - any time of year

In a perfect location to walk up and experience the Pacific Coast! Even in the winter a wonderful place to visit. Access is easy at the end of Ocean Ave - ample free public parking winter weekdays. Recommend grab a lunch to go from an Ocean Ave restaurant. Take a walk toward Pebble Beach during low tide, or just sit at the lookout. Dog friendly, too!

Popular spot for locals and tourists
Beautiful beach, very clean. Lots of people were here with their dogs and children enjoying being out in nature.

Came in town for the birthday weekend and went down to the Carmel beach to enjoyed the beautiful sunny weather. Husband and I admired the landscape and kids enjoyed the waves. Walked along the beach and had a good time while there.
Nice view and surrounded by beautiful houses close to the beach ! Very well Prepared for tourists and amazing sunset
This is a lovely, though busy, beach. We went lat afternoon/evening and the parking was still difficult. We parked in town and walked down. As the sun went down the sunset was beautiful.
Beautiful beach next to Carmel Beach. Great place for relaxing & picnics. Frequently see dolphins & whales in the distance.
Excellent Beach for Families and Dogs!

This beach is one of the best beaches I have ever been to. I took my dog here and she had a blast meeting other dogs. The surrounding houses and town itself make it a nice tourist attraction. I would definitely recommend others to visit this beach.

Great drive along coast with photo stops . Lovely rugged coast line and billionaire mansions to look at ..
One of the best beach Sands in the world

As a young kid growing up in the Bay Area this was one of my go to beaches next to Santa Cruz, even at that time the sand was some of the softest cleanest ever to be found in California the sand is so soft and fluffy it squeaks between your toes as you walk on it. There's not very much parking here so come early. It now seems to be a very large tourist attraction. If you never been to California or you want to check out a beautiful Beach for the first time this is a must. I must also say that Santa Cruz and more south of Pismo Beach the beaches have gone downhill.. they seem to have kept this one up and its free.. all the other California beaches now charge to park at tourist and non tourist areas.

Where Carmel California natives go to the beach

My wife and her sister grew up in Carmel, and the beach of choice for recreation, particularly family recreation, is the beach at the mouth of the Carmel river. On the landward side is the beautiful salt marsh - the lagoon - sloping u[ to the Mission Ranch, and on the seaward side, across the barrier sandbar, the Pacific ocean, with Point Lobos dominating the horizon. The lagoon side offers sheltered, shallow-water wading for the youngsters; the ocean side is somewhat dangerous because of the undertow, but is a great vantage point for wave-watching and beach combing. Never crowded, an ideal spot. Occasionally the sand bar is breached (by bulldozers) to allow the river to flow into the sea and lower the level of the lagoon, a spectacular sight.

Wonderful walks with numerous dogs of all types and sizes. Kris brought his puppy Kepa an Italian Mastif along with our small mutt. Best free entertainment on the planet
It is a nice place where you can park your auto (easiest convenient free place) and begin to explore a Carmel by the sea or walk along the beach.
Beautiful beach with lots of people walking around, playing with their dogs and children, watching surfers, and otherwise enjoying almost perfect weather in Carmel. Wish I lived here.

Let me start by saying that I have a dog and I always have had a dog but I think the city is quickly becoming "Canine Carmel".

This beach is over run with dogs. The city itself is dog crazy. There was not one restaurant or coffee house that I visited that didn't have a dog. The art galleries appear to be the exception.
People even bring their dogs to a nice dinner out in town.

The view at this beach is beautiful and there is hardly a more scenic stretch of coastline. It is a 5 star beach without the cavalcade of canines. Just be aware that you will encounter dogs off the leash here.
I wish they had dog hours and non dog hours.

"Who let the dogs out?" You ask?
Carmel, that's who.

If you have a four-legged family member, you simply can't go wrong with bringing them on your vacation to Carmel. There's no shortage of dog-friendly shops, restaurants, beach, and outdoor spaces. Beach is completely off-leash and there are tons of dogs for your furry friends to make friends.

Watch sunset here on your way to dinner! Maybe go for a nice walk as well. Beautiful beach, close to town.

I have been to many places in the U.S. as well as in Europe, but Carmel is one of the most beautiful places i have ever been to. The beach, the Pacific Ocean, The hillsides, the town and its shops and galleries.......everything is just lovely.

Beautiful place to visit when traveling down South from San Fransisco. Quiet, relaxing place to chill, unwind, go for long walks and/ or to spend a romantic time. I enjoyed to variety of Italian restaurants of excellent quality and cosy coffee shops. Will for sure visit Camel again next year!

beautiful place to watch the sunset
can be a good walk to get down to the beach and an even tougher walk back up from the beach. area enjoyed by the locals. the dogs seemed to really enjoy the beach. can be breezing.
Beautiful beach and not very crowded

It's a beautiful beach, we went during low tide and had a lovely time in the sun. There were very few people around and we could find parking easily. It had a small parking lot so must be getting quite busy in summer. There were changing rooms/toilets as well. The river was cut off from the sea, maybe it connects only during high tide.

We took our Golden Retriever to the beach twice while we were in Carmel. He loved it, including meeting many other dogs and playing in the surf...

Great sandy beach in a bay with waves and beautiful sunsets. This town as everyone seems to know is a dog lovers town. They are also on the beach. People behavier is fantastic. Polite, careful and attentive to others. It’s a very clean beach. It shoud be used as an example of how it is possible for all to enjoy the sea..

Loved Carmel! What a beautiful city with plenty of activities to do as a couple or with family and friends.

The beach at Carmel is a must see when you're there. Weekend parking is tight, but during the week, there are lots of spots right by the beach. Beautiful white sand. Long walks in the sun are so enjoyable. Many residents bring their dogs there to run both on the sand and in the water. There is lots of space for everyone. Some people picnic there as there are lots of restaurants and snack places a couple blocks away.

Beautiful beach but remember that it is COOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOLLLD
love walking there and very clean and calm but of course lots of people visiting. relaxing to have a picnic but the water is cold. too bad it is not as warm as the Mediterranean Sea.
Very clean beach, easy parking, great views of the ocean and fun for the kids to play in...Bring warm clothes
A world class beach at the foot of town, Carmel, this place just about has it all. Enjoy the beach activities or easily walk up in town. The fun is up to you.
We stopped at this beautiful beach. So nice to have a beautiful beach like this so close to ‘downtown’ Carmel. Quintessential Northern California Beach.

Visited Carmel Beach on a Sunday morning recently...the experience is always the same. Natural beauty in every direction one turns. Never crowded. Lots of friendly dogs. Can't find a better spot for an early morning coffee :)

Carmel by the Sea
We stopped at Carmel by the Sea and were absolutely charmed by the downtown. It had many many art galleries and stores selling attractive items like Tiffany-design lamps made of colored sea-shells, embossed leather Cowboy boots and crystal Christmas ornaments! Of course, Carmel being an upscale artists’ enclave, it also had its share of the big brands along with the local Boutiques and restaurants. Our lunch at the Mediterranean restaurant was delicious!

Lovely long white sand beach. Very popular with tourists visiting. We only visited for a short while but were suitably impressed.

Travelling from San Francisco to Los Angeles we decided to get off the highway and drive along the coast. Very scenic, beaches, smaller towns, and Carmel. Home to Clint Eastwood and Doris Day in the past.

Kick off your shoes and dare yourself...
Kick off your shoes and dare yourself to step into the cool water. It is a fantastic place alone, with a special someone, or family and friends. Take the time and cross this off your bucket list.

Absolutely beautiful scenery. Pack some good shoes to walk down from the street and some others to swamp into for the beach. Parking is probably the only difficult part of the entire experience. Everything else was fantastic.
Most Pet-Friendly Beach in the World

We love Carmel Beach because our dogs can roam free. The coast line is beautiful. All the dogs and people get along. The sunsets are spectacular. It is warm during the day usually but foggy and cool in the mornings and evenings. Carmel Beach is a must see for tourists.

Take the walk from 8th Ave to Carmel River beach for a world class ocean promenade. Or join the dogs running on the wide sands.
Loved walking on the beach every morning. Sand is not sticky. People are out with their dogs and children and are very friendly.

Both beaches are beautiful. The steep walk to the ocean at the bottom of Ocean Avenue is fun, but walking back up in the soft sand is a real chore. I recommend driving down Scenic Rd, parking,and taking a set of steps to the beach. Or, you can just walk the promenade and sit on one of the benches and watch the surf and people.

Beautiful beach that is walking distance from anywhere in Carmel. Went one evening to watch the sunset. Lots of people there with their dogs- all friendly.
Hardly any people around when there. Easy access for the majority. For you camera buffs be sure yours is handy. You, I am sure will end up with some beautiful pictures.
Took many pictures The waves were awesome and sunsets were beautiful. The water is very cold in November!!
The most beautiful beach I have seen. driftwood collectors paradise, if you are local enough Watch out for the Squirrels.

We stopped by the Carmel City Beach while we were in town. It was wonderful. It's a beautiful location with the Pebble Beach golf course bordering it. It's a classic Northern California beach. People enjoying the beach and being outdoors, many families and people with dogs.

Go and take in the view. White sands. Looks great for windsurfing . Bit of an uphill walk to Carmel by the Sea but great to visit

My children were wine tasting and everyone told them to go see the sunset. Sadly, it was cloudy but the beach is still beautiful. My husband, son, daughter-in-law, daughter, son and myself are visiting from the East Coast.
Some of the loveliest beaches anywhere.

Carmel City Beach, or as locals often refer to it, Ocean Beach because it's at the bottom of Ocean Avenue, is a wonderful spot for picnics, dogs, and long walks.The Carmel River Beach is also particularly delightful from where you can watch amazing sea life not far off shore, including whales spouting and sometimes breaching. The sand is clean, the wildlife enchanting. When I lived at the other end of the path from the mouth of the river, I would walk it every day, visiting the cross at the top of the knoll that marked an historic time. It's revivifying that I often walked it twice a day, and sometimes even more. Delightfully peaceful and calming.

We didn’t take the dogs this time. We got our dog fix at the Cypress Inn and Carmel beach. Lovely white sand beach. Cliffs with lovely homes.

Surprisingly I enjoy Carmel most in the fall, spring and winter. One would expect it to be a summer location. It’s foggy in summer. Try it off season.

Wonderful; a calm and serene place to enjoy quality time, food and beach

Carmel-by-the-sea is a hidden gem as it cannot be compared with other beach villages; it has no billboards, no major commercial advertizing, no fast food chains - everything is based on enjoying quality in life! Given the fact that many of the houses have a unique style, which resembles old German/old English style, it very much felt as if we had landed in a Fairytale. As if Nottingham Forest is just around the corner.

The center village is really nice and offers quality shops, coffee bars and reataurants.

Looking for a piece of heaven? Here it is!

This small town is well worth a visit. Very quaint and many unique little shops, great for those who enjoy the creative arts.

Went down end of September just to wade and sit in the sand. If you have a cane (I do~) caution because dog-friendly also means jumpers! Wading was perfectly cold (as desired) and the waves were low that time of day. HC parking was fine, although I did notice jams and conflict further up the avenue, as parking was getting very tight. Restrooms were not too horrible - it's a beach! - and the smell was tolerable. More like permanent outhouse than a real restroom. Bring your own food/drink - food truck line was long and with a cane a hard wait.

Drove down to the beach at the bottom of Ocean Ave. Was able to find parking. Not to crowded at eleven in the morning. Water calm and clear.
The best beach I have EVER been to - June 2013
I could have spent all day here. It was beautiful, and peaceful. I would highly recommend going here.

We arrived to the dog friendly beach at 10 a.m. on a Thursday. Parking was available at that time. There were many people, local and tourists, walking on the beach and viewing from the lookout. We accessed the beach via the sandy walkway. There were dolphins playing and swimming just off shore. The view of the ocean is fantastic. The beach is beautifully kept.

Beautiful beach, great for walking, great for watching dolphins and sea lions and pelicans or just sitting, reading and people watching. Dogs are allowed which is a plus. The his would be a 5, if there were shells you could collect like Pismo Beach....
An obvious favorite for locals and tourists for a reason. I wish we had more time to mince on the beach but had to leave after a few sunset pics.
I love this charming little town. The beach is just stunning and the views are breathtaking. Wish the water was warmer :)
Any drive along the California coast is gorgeous. We particularly enjoyed this drive for the Carmel neighborhoods it brought us through, the unique homes we saw and of course the views!!

We made a special side trip on our way from San Francisco to LA and it was well worth it. The place is so cute and relaxing with a wonderful drive along the beach.

After Monterey aquarium we swim by this town to pay respect to the ex mayor Mr. Clint Eastwood and the local shops and restaurants. We stop by the beach for a short stop. The parking was easy. We were able to park right in front of the beach with public toilets. The walk to the beach was a snap. The sunset was beautiful and the people are nice.

One of a kind. Just start walking and take in the views. Easy access and walk until your tired and head back. Good spot for picnic and sometimes hot coffee. Pick your weather.

one of California's truly beautiful beaches

Accordingly all I had time for at Carmel City Beach was regret that I didn't have time to explore and at least get a dip in the Pacific . This is the place to go and the town of Carmel is a delight. Lots of good restaurants but they’re a walk from the beach where there seems to be no refreshment outlets.

I've always heard about the view, but this quaint town is just perfect! So much to do in a very small area. Pretty and elderly friendly, food of all sorts and styles. The beaches area spectacular and the locals are awesome.

Even if you're a tourist, you'll feel like a local because there are so many people walking dogs, throwing Frisbees, sketching the views, and just enjoying the setting. One of the loveliest beaches I have ever seen. Houses on front are pretty. Sandy. Need to avoid May grey and June gloom if you want to sunbathe! We enjoyed walking in grey May weather.
A great walk down Ocean Blvd to the beach, it's beautiful and peaceful. On the way back, walk back up to the neighborhood and see beautiful homes.
The beach and drive along is stunningly beautiful it takes your breath away. We always love driving the road along the beach it's like nothing else around. Lovely homes along the way too.

The beach is beautiful. Totally unspoilt white sand and an amazing views from any point. We also has an opportunity to see a pod of dolphins in the surf which was brilliant! And to the guys looking to propose on holiday... this is the place it worked for me!!!

There are public toilets by the car park, but be warned they don't smell very pleasant!

Beautiful! One of the nicest beaches....

We walked from our hotel at San Carlos and 5th which took about 15 minutes. The tree lined walk is lovely and we enjoyed the weather too! The Carmel Beach was just beautiful, pristine, clean, white sand, crystal clear water and one of the nicest beaches I've ever been to. The low humidity is an extra delight!! Our route to the beach was a cinch being all downhill which means uphill upon return. It wasn't a bad walk but be aware just in case someone has difficulty walking. I don't know if there is another route to the beach which has less of a hill but you can drive to the beach. We were there on a Sunday (after Labor Day) and there was plenty of available parking. Walked the Scenic Road Walkway to here. The beach is very nice and unlike Carmel Bay it was not crowded (maybe just got lucky?) and there was no steep hill to walk up or down to access the beach. There were restrooms.

We visited Carmel, parked on the Main Street and explored the town on foot. Walking down to the beach is well worth the effort, the views are stunning. The huge slope of sand going down to the beach makes you feel like a kid again... also there are some old massive weather worn trees on the beach, stunning and impressive, a sight to see....

We had a great time on a beach. The parking was easier on a weekday than on a weekend but there is plenty of street parking around. We built sandcastles, flown a kite and jumped in the waves. There are restrooms at the main parking area.

Mom came with us. We parked on a local street and walked over to the beach. Lovely white sand. Nearby attractions and cities. Scenic drives

Very nice view but cold. Once you get to beach - it's still a walk to the actual water. Very rough. And a bit of a hike back up hill. There is bathhouse. It's a hike back up to town But they do have Uber!!
we went near sunset and the light was just so magnificent. When people talk about Carmel, this is where it's at!
We walked up and down the beach, enjoyed the view of Pebble Beach, the beautiful Ocean & Beach, it's a very nice walk on the Beach.

Went to Carmel when my Son got Married there. Got there a day earlier then everyone else . Visited the many boutiques , delicious restaurants , and their amazing beach . The people there were very friendly . Would highly recommend Carmel for you next trip . Such a pleasant lovely place.

What a beautiful beach. White sand , clean and pleasant people about with their families. Take a picnic and soak it all in. Remember though to pack your trash bags to ensure to keep this gem sparkling. It is a treasure here!!!
This is a beautiful beach within walking distance of downtown Carmel shops, restaurants, and galleries.
Wonderful, albeit a little chilly in May!

We drove to here from San Francisco and even the drive down was so scenic! We had a wonderful time walking through the town down to the beach and had lunch at an amazing restaurant. It can get a little windy in May so make sure to layer-up!

I went for a morning walk before the kids were up and I dragged them there the second they were up. It was well worth the nagging as we were all giddy with its beauty within moments. The sun glinting off the cliffs of Pebble Beach, the dogs frolicking in the waves, the mystical trees overhanging the bluffs...pure magic!!

Carmel City Beach is gorgeous! The surf is good, scenery spectacular, sand white and soft and it is within walking distance of town and shops/restaurants.

The beach is great and you can walk along way along. The shops in Carmel are quirky and really interesting to wander around even if you don't want to buy anything. I cannot recommend this place enough (although I would say take a sweater - it's pretty chilly!)

Huge waves and fine sand. This beach was not extremely busy and had lots to see. Watched an otter as well as surfers. Restrooms near the parking. Loved the vegetation with many photo opportunities.
This is a very peaceful beach with white sand. A pleasant place for an evening stroll. If you are looking for beaches with dramatic scenery, you will have to go to the beaches in or around Big Sur.
Quieter compared to Carmel's main beach. Good for a picnic and meditation. Not as good for swimming. Nice scenic views too.

This is a gorgeous beach along the coast!!!! Big sandy beach with restrooms. Come for the day and pack a picnic and enjoy this beach! Not crowded like the one at the end of Ocean Ave in Carmel By The Sea.

If you are not from west coast, you may not realize how cool the summers can be along the coast, or that the waters of the Pacific in this area are cold. Carmel has a beautiful beach, and the day we were there was our lucky day because I noticed something floating in the water far away. With the telephoto lens on my camera I could tell it was a sea otter! (see photo).

Good location Nice pictures take from this point Must see to enjoy Take nice walk by the beach And amazing views People very friendly and helpful My kids take amazing pictures of the bay And enjoy the walk

I came here with my family early on a weekend. Parking was not a problem because we arrived so early and there was a heavy mist that hadn't cleared up yet. We played in the sand and dipped our toes in the waves. We even saw some dolphins swimming a little bit off shore. Cute dogs abounded but owners were very considerate in making sure that the dogs didn't spook our kids. Overall, a great experience even if the water is too cold for a swim.

If you're visiting definitely do not miss the opportunity to walk down along the beach. There are frequently dolphins in the morning and at night you can have a fire and roast marshmallows in certain spots on the beach. This is also one of the only beaches where dogs can run off leash. Make sure they are well-trained and come when you call, though.

There must have been more dogs on this beach than people the morning we were walking along it (all with owners I should add). Nice beach but sadly the mist had descended so visibility was poor. Still, a nice walk on the beach and along the cliffs back to the town centre.

Cruising the west, sommer vacation. After having a not so positive experience with San Francisco we drove south and stopped in Carmel. We went to the beach and found it very nice, met some locals and go recommendations for lunch. Carmel is on the revisiting list.

Spectacular views. Water cold this time of year, but the beach walk with the water on one side and cool homes on the other is not to be missed.
This beach is so nice. Beautiful all around. The white sand is so soft under the feet. The water is coooold of course (it is Carmel!) I love it here walking along the shore.
One of my favorite beaches in the area! We loved the wide beach and the white sands. Parking is a little scarce though and can get quite frustrating.

The Carmel Garden Inn is a delightful Inn with incredibly warm, friendly and attentive service to all that enter including furry family! Everyone involved at the Inn is focused on going over and above to assure that you have a wonderful visit to charming Carmel. From the endless supply of dog treats to the homemade breakfasts and wine hour specialties, the staff is one of a kind in their commitment to service. There are no store bought muffins here! The patio rooms have large comfortable patios with beautiful plants and a table and chairs. They are perfect for relaxing with your four legged friends. It is a joy traveling to an Inn where they not just allow pets but welcome them with open arms and hearts! You will also be happy to know that they can provide towels, blankets and a hose for those necessary pup cleanups after a day at the fun-filled dog beach!! Thank you to all of our new friends at the Carmel Garden Inn for making our vacation so memorable! We will cherish our memories of our time spent with all of you!!
